title: show my name in voter list
creator: saratkchakra

title: I want to use Ctrl+1, 2, 3, .... (with and without shift also) to open speed dials
content:
I want to use a key to open Speed dials in the same tab and same key with 'Shift' to open that speed dial in a new tab.

My favourite were Ctrl+1, 2, 3, 4 ... and so on. And when I used Ctrl+Shift+1, 2, 3 etc, then they opened in a new tab. But now the Ctrl+1, 2, etc are focusing already open tabs. How to revert to old behavior of these shortcut keys?

I've read several articles on using extensions like 'Shortkeys (Custom Keyboard Shortcuts)', but those don't let me use C+1, 2, etc. Also another method of using to js files (auto.js something) doesn't seem to do this job, as I think that would only disable some KeySrtcs altogether.
creator: zopfan

title: Sites you have never visited will be marked as “visited” and recommended first.
content: If I enter "na", the namu.wiki site, which I have never visited, appears as a recommendation. Even though I reset my visit history and settings, that site still appears as a recommendation. Is there a solution?
creator: applesyrup

title: Firefox does not open
content: Hi ! I was using Firefox until yesterday when it failed to open a window. I deleted and reinstalled Firefox, got rid of all stored data to no avail. I run Mac OS 14.4.1 on a Studio desktop and prefer Firefox to all other browsers.
creator: rhhftbvxqh

title: Serious Problem: Firefox Only Opens In "Safe Mode"???
content:
Greetings everyone,

I've had this problem for a while and I don't know what to do.

I had a problem where Firefox kept crashing before it had finished loading up all of my former tabs and windows and so I was given the option of opening Firefox in "Safe mode" which I did, but now Firefox only starts in "Safe mode"...

I'm running the most up to date version of Firefox.

Thank you for any help!
creator: hsma4099

title: Upgrade to Firefox is now blocking connection of all new tabs
content:
I just upgraded Firefox by downloading & installing the latest Firefox update. Now every time I start a new tab it tells me "Gah. Your tab just crashed" It does the same thing when I try to view my password list in Firefox. 

How do I stop this?  My email is bill.8720@protonmail.com.
creator: bill.8720
